Short Variable Description: Is there the presence of any type of armed conflict? Coded as a dummy variable (i.e., 1 for armed con- flict, 0 for no armed conflict).
Battle-related deaths (log of battle related deaths plus 1)
Cited Original Source: Peace Research Institute Oslo (PRIO) and Uppsala Conflict Data Program (UCDP)
The Hague Center for Strategic Studies (2014)
Center for Systemic Peace, Polity IV Dataset; Transformed by EWP

Short Variable Description: Extrajudicial Killing by government officials without due process of law (0-2)

Cited Original Source: Hsu et al. (2016) / Sea Around Us (n.d.)

Short Variable Description:
Freedom of Assembly and Association. Freedom to associate with other
persons in political parties, trade unions, cultural organizations, or other special-interest groups (0-2).
Freedom of discussion: Are citizens able to openly discuss political issues in private homes and in public spaces?

Electoral Self-Determination. Freedom to associate with other
persons in political parties, trade unions, cultural organizations, or other special-interest groups (0-2).

Freedom of Speech. The extent to which freedoms of speech and press are affected by
government censorship, including ownership of media outlets (0-2).
Freedom of Domestic Movement. This variable indicates citizens’ freedom to travel within their own country (0-2).

Freedom of movement for women: Are all women able to move freely, in daytime and nighttime, in public thoroughfares, across regions within a country, and to establish permanent residency where they wish?
Freedom of Foreign Movement. This variable indicates citizens’ freedom to leave and return to their country (0-2).
Freedom of movement for men: Are all men able to move freely, in daytime and nighttime, in public thoroughfares, across regions within a country, and to establish permanent residency where they wish?
Annual % change in GDP per capita

Independence of the Judiciary. Indicates the extent to which the judiciary is independent of control from other
sources, such as another branch of the government or the military (0-2).
Minority control: Does a minority control political rule?
Party ban: Are any parties banned?

Physical Integrity Rights Index. An additive index constructed from the Torture, Extrajudicial Killing, Political
Imprisonment, and Disappearance indicators (0-8).
Restrictions on candidates: Are all groups (ethnicity, race, religion, or language) allowed to run for political positions?

Political Imprisonment. Incarceration of people by government officials because of: speech; opposition to government; religious
beliefs; or their membership in a group (0-2).
Women’s Political Rights. Women’s political rights include a number of internationally recognized rights (0-3).
A mean of Physical Integrity Rights - Political Terror Scale (Amnesty) and Physical Integrity Rights - Political Terror Scale (US State Department)
Cited Original Source: Political Terror Scale (Amnesty) and Political Terror Scale (US State Department)

Short Variable Description: Do political killings occur? Political killings are killings by the state or its agents without due process of law for the purpose of eliminating political opponents. These killings are the result of deliberate use of lethal force by the police, security forces, prison officials, or other agents of the state (including paramilitary groups).

Empowerment Rights Index. An additive index constructed from the Freedom of Movement, Freedom of Speech,
Workers’ Rights, Political Participation, and Freedom of Religion indicators (0-10).
A multi-faceted scale encompassing both the laws on rape and prevalence
Whether enclaves of high rape exists such as refugee camps
Taboo and security for wonen reporting rape

Freedom of Religion. The extent to which the freedom of citizens to exercise and practice their
religious beliefs is subject to actual government restrictions (0-1).
Freedom of religion: Is there freedom of religion?
Percentage of sex workers living with HIV. For the full definition, please see indicator 3.3 in the Global AIDS Monitoring 2019 Guidelines.
Power distributed by social group: Is political power distributed according to social groups?
Cited Original Source: Varieties of Democracy (V-DEM), Pemstein et al. (2019, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2019:21)

Short Variable Description: Inequality in civil liberties by social group: Do some social groups (as distinguished by language, ethnicity, religion, race, region, or caste) have fewer civil liberties than others?
Red List Index of species survival (0-1)
Torture by government officials or by private individuals at the instigation of government officials (0-2)
Tradeshare in combined. Trade openness (log): Trade as percentage of Gross Domestic Product (GDP).

Cited Original Source: Varieties of Democracy Project (V-DEM) (see Coppedge, Lindberg, & Skaaning, 2015)

Short Variable Description: Workers rights (0-2): a minimum age for the employment of children; and acceptable conditions of work with respect to minimum wages, hours of work, compulsory labour, and occupational safety and health.
